results.title: Zootopia
results.creator_credit: Cory Loftis, Jared Bush, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore, Byron Howard and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Determined to prove herself, Officer Judy Hopps, the first bunny on Zootopia’s police force, jumps at the chance to crack her first case - even if it means partnering with scam-artist fox Nick Wilde to solve the mystery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cory Loftis, Jared Bush, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore, Byron Howard and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.description:
Walt Disney Animation Studio’s Academy Award-winning Zootopia (2016) follows a rookie cop who sets out to uncover a dangerous conspiracy that’s turning the peaceful animals of Zootopia back into their savage states. A small-town bunny rabbit, Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin) has to work with the sly fox Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman), a hustler who can guide her through the city’s underworld to get to the bottom of the case.

This concept sketch by Cory Loftis represents the bustling metropolis teeming with instantly classic animal characters, including Judy and Nick, but also Chief Bogo (Idris Elba), Benjamin Clawhauser (Nate Torrence), Dawn Bellwether (Jenny Slate) and Yax (Tommy Chong).

Winner of the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature, as well as the Golden Globe, Critic’s Choice Movie Award and the Annie Award, Zootopia was critically acclaimed for its memorable characters, animation and story about seeing past our prejudices.
description_for_label:

results.title: Zoomfilm
results.brief_description: An experimental film dedicated to the “blink”. Dynamic abstractions (created through use of prodigious optical printing and directly working the film frame) investigate the nature of human optics. Music by Maurizio Kagel.
results.description: An experimental film dedicated to the “blink”. Dynamic abstractions (created through use of prodigious optical printing and directly working the film frame) investigate the nature of human optics. Music by Maurizio Kagel.

results.title: Zoolander [DVD]
results.creator_credit: VH1 Films, Ben Stiller, Paramount Pictures, Village Roadshow Pictures, Scott Rudin and Stuart Cornfeld
results.brief_description: Ben Stiller directed, co-wrote and starred in this comedy, which spoofs the world of male models. The idea, which began as a Stiller skit in 1996, is teased into a feature length film. The story centres on Derek Zoolander (Stiller) - a famous male model, three-time winner of model of the year and creator of several iconic looks including Le Tigre and Blue steel. Derek’s reign is threatened by the rise of Hansel McDonald (Owen Wilson) a male model whose freewheeling attitude makes him hotter than the 90s flavoured Derek. The plot centres on rivalry between the two models and the assassination of the Malaysian Prime Minister, whose new anti-child labour laws threatens the lucrative fashion trade. “Zoolander” satirises modelling, beauty, the cult of celebrity, nightclubs, MTV and VH1 type of fashion awards. One of the sharpest sequences in the film is a ‘walk-off’ between the two models, judged by none other than David Bowie. Numerous film references are peppered throughout including - 2001: A Space odyssey, the X-Files, the Manchurian candidate and Trading places. Cast includes: Jerry Stiller, David Duchovny, Vince Vaughn, Christine Taylor and Will Ferrell, with cameos by Billy Zane, Wynona Ryder, Donald Trump, Christina Slater, Lenny Kravitz, Gwen Stefani and Donatella Versace.

results.title: Zookeepers
results.creator_credit: Dugan Rosalini and Dugan Rosalini Film Associates
results.brief_description: An informative and accurate depiction of the behind-the-scenes activities of a zoo, showing the care and feeding of animals and hygiene practices. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dugan Rosalini and Dugan Rosalini Film Associates

results.title: Zoo with class
results.creator_credit: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of all aspects of the Melbourne Zoo Education Service. Looks at its philosophy on environmental education, the teaching programmes, curriculum developments and cosultancy. The program also reveals how the zoo education service can become an extension of the classroom and seeks to enable teachers to plan school-based environmental education programs in which the zoo school plays an integral role.

results.title: Zoo tails
results.creator_credit: Tosca Looby, Gill Lomas and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: 20 short zoo stories are contained on this tape narrated by an 11 year old boy. Discover tapirs, owl chicks, big cats, hippos, seals, a baby puma, plus many more animals. Filmed at the Melbourne Zoo by ABC’s award winning Natural History Unit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tosca Looby, Gill Lomas and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit

results.title: Zoo Robbery (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Six kids find themselves in a real life game of cops and robbers when the London Zoo’s star attraction, Yen-Yen the Yeti mysteriously disappears. An action drama to satisfy every kid’s dream. Rated: G

results.title: Zoo Olympics
results.creator_credit: Picha, Eric Van Beuren, Francis Nielsen, Y C Alligatorfilm and Rooster Studio
results.brief_description: Drawn by French animator Picha, here are 26 episodes of the hilarious animal Olympics antics. These are parodies of Olympic events, based vaguely on behaviours in the animal kingdom, such as egg laying and rolling (chickens), slop slurping (pigs) and kangaroo boxing.
